question_sentence: A judge ruled that the use of which emoji constituted a “binding signature” in a contractual dispute?
evidence: In a significant legal ruling, a Canadian judge has declared that the “thumbs-up” emoji carries the same legal weight as a traditional signature. The judge argued that courts must embrace the evolving communication methods of the “new reality” as he passed a verdict demanding a farmer pay C$82,000 (£47,648) for an unfulfilled contract with a grain buyer.

question_sentence: What percentage of British adults reportedly has an unfavourable view of campaign group Just Stop Oil?
evidence: The figure is up 15 points from 51% in April, according to polling from YouGov. Only 17% of British adults have a favourable view of the group Just Stop Oil, which has disrupted several major sporting events this summer.

question_sentence: Taylor Swift has retrospectively changed the lyrics to which of her songs?
evidence: Global star Taylor Swift has re-released her 2010 album “Speak Now” as part of an ongoing re-recording project. But fans are divided over changes to the lyrics of the album’s tenth track, “Better Than Revenge”. In the original version, Swift accuses a girl who has stolen her love interest of being “better known for the things that she does / On the mattress.”

question_sentence: Tourists will need to pay a €5 entrance fee to see which world-famous site in Rome?
evidence: Italy’s ministry of culture says the new €5 entrance fee will go towards maintaining the Pantheon, but there are concerns over the new ticketing system which has proved difficult to access. Tourists have struggled at other sites where a fee has been introduced, such as the Colosseum, partly because tour operators buy up tickets in bulk.

question_sentence: A California sea otter keeps stealing what, according to reports?
evidence: A sea otter keeps pinching surfers’ boards in California, according to The Telegraph. The five-year-old animal, known as Otter 841, has been jumping onto boards and nudging their owners out of the way, so she can have a bask. For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Vladimir Putin’s luxury “ghost train” reportedly carries what kind of machines?
evidence: London-based Russian investigations group the Dossier Center offered a rare glimpse into the private life of Vladimir Putin, obtaining photos of his lavish 22-carriage “ghost train”, equipped with what appear to be “anti-ageing machines”. Other features include a fully equipped Turkish bath steam room and a massage parlour.

question_sentence: The Dutch prime minister Mark Rutte unexpectedly announced he would be stepping down after how many years in power?
evidence: Mark Rutte, the longest-serving Dutch prime minister in history, will stand down after 13 years in power. Nicknamed “Teflon Mark” for his ability to withstand political crises, Rutte unexpectedly announced he would leave politics after the autumn general election. In the 27-nation EU, only Hungary’s Viktor Orban has been in charge for longer.

question_sentence: It emerged this week that Boris Johnson notably forgot what?
evidence: The government missed Monday’s deadline to hand over Boris Johnson’s WhatsApp messages, because the former prime minister was said to have forgotten the passcode for his old phone. A spokesperson for the former prime minister said Johnson wishes to cooperate with the inquiry. Andrew Whaley, an expert in cybersecurity, dismissed Johnson’s passcode claim, telling Sky News it was a “pretty lame excuse” and that “accessing the data would take minutes”.

question_sentence: Sweden is building the world’s largest what?
evidence: The “world’s largest urban construction project in wood” will be built in Stockholm, announced Sweden, which could pave the way for similar structures in the future. Although the plan could be more sustainable than traditional construction, there are concerns about potential fire hazards. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Japan has infuriated neighbours with its plans to release what into the ocean?
evidence: Ever since the 2011 tsunami destroyed the Fukushima nuclear plant, Japan has been pumping water into the site to cool the reactor’s fuel rods – contaminating 130,000 litres a day. Now, the government plans to release a million metric tons of this treated radioactive water into the ocean, “enough to fill 500 Olympic-size swimming pools”, to intense opposition from China and many Pacific islands.

question_sentence: Following the launch of Meta’s app Threads, which social network saw a major drop in traffic?
evidence: Twitter’s traffic tanked following the launch of Meta’s rival app Threads, which topped more than 100 million users within five days after its debut.

question_sentence: Millions of Americans were under flood alerts across the Northeast this week. Which state received almost two months of rain in two days?
evidence: More than 200 people have been rescued since Sunday in Vermont, where flooding has submerged homes and turned streets into rivers.

question_sentence: The CDC issued new guidelines this week for people looking to import which type of animal into the US?
evidence: For the first time in 70 years, the CDC is changing how dogs are imported into the US to prevent rabies from arriving from overseas.

question_sentence: Which drink company is receiving criticism for allegedly marketing high-caffeine products to children?
evidence: This week, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said the FDA should investigate the high caffeine content in Prime Energy drinks and the company’s marketing efforts toward children on social media.

question_sentence: Which state is adding more homeless people every year than any other state in the US?
evidence: Half of all Americans living outside on the streets live in California. More than 170,000 unhoused people currently live in the state — and that figure is growing, federal data shows.

question_sentence: Climate change is making Earth’s oceans change color, new research finds. Which color are they changing to?
evidence: Tropical oceans have become greener in the past two decades, reflecting changes in their ecosystems that have more phytoplankton present.

question_sentence: The nominees for the 75th Emmy Awards — television’s top honor — were announced this week. Which show received the most nominations?
evidence: HBO’s “Succession” led with 27 Emmy nominations, followed by “The Last of Us” with 24. The Emmy Awards are currently scheduled for September 18. (HBO, which like CNN, is owned by Warner Bros. Discovery.)

question_sentence: Which popular European travel destination is seeing triple-digit temperatures that recently left several tourists incapacitated due to heat stroke?
evidence: In Italy, an intensifying heat wave has already claimed at least one life and left several tourists in Rome incapacitated due to heat stroke, officials said.

question_sentence: Which country is attempting to be the second nation to put people on the moon?
evidence: China is pursuing plans to land astronauts on the lunar surface before 2030.

question_sentence: Which legendary music artist recently retired after touring for decades?
evidence: Elton John’s final tour came to an end with a performance in Stockholm, Sweden, this month. Listen to the heartfelt message he shared with his fans.
